source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

linkedContent: crypt’s impenetrability, crypt’s failure to prevent seeping, its angular inscriptions run along a divided line of “fantasmatic doubleness”: each fantasy “double and opposed”

linkedContent: forums are politico-juridical instances, require a third, a witness (like a duel), tribunal instruisant un procès, mettant en cause

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings

content: incorporation (magic, secret, cryptic, instantaneous) seals loss of object, the dead, an exquisite corpse, loves the dead safe (save) inside me, as dead; introjection (slow, gradual, laborious, effective) dead save in me as living, enlarge the self (introj. as normal mourning)

linkedContent: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve

linkedContent: crypt: pocket of resistance

content: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place
linkedContent: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place

linkedContent: [re: Wolf Man] choice btwn 2 catastrophes: 1) love his sister to avoid killing her 2) kill his sister to avoid loving her

motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: when introjection is thwarted, contradiction sets in, and a opposition of forces constructs crypt and props up marketplace, rates, laws, forum or for
linkedContent: when introjection is thwarted, contradiction sets in, and a opposition of forces constructs crypt and props up marketplace, rates, laws, forum or for

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume
linkedContent: “conservative” repression installs in the unconscious what the Self treats as an exquisite corpse, a “surrealism” of folded sentences loses its creases, the paper flattens out, and there is a spot (lieu) of pleasure disguised as pain, which the therapist must exhume

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: very thing that provokes worst suffering must be kept alive, the outpouring of libido at the moment of loss is repressed, not in and of itself, but in relation w/ the dead
linkedContent: very thing that provokes worst suffering must be kept alive, the outpouring of libido at the moment of loss is repressed, not in and of itself, but in relation w/ the dead

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: not hysterical repression, which works via prohibition (not foreign place, nor exclusion)
linkedContent: not hysterical repression, which works via prohibition (not foreign place, nor exclusion)

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”
linkedContent: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu
linkedContent: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text > crypter, c’est chiffrer ——one can never manipulate a secret code alone
linkedContent: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text > crypter, c’est chiffrer ——one can never manipulate a secret code alone

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: machinery of words, calculating shrewdness, mêkhanê, theater of words, autonomization of language > in The Magic Word who holds the dictionaries?
linkedContent: machinery of words, calculating shrewdness, mêkhanê, theater of words, autonomization of language > in The Magic Word who holds the dictionaries?

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: melancholic crypt: shelters one’s own lost and incorporated object; Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic, it shelters illegitimate object of another [his sister] [ghost effect?]
linkedContent: melancholic crypt: shelters one’s own lost and incorporated object; Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic, it shelters illegitimate object of another [his sister] [ghost effect?]

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: the reason a code is indispensable to a crypt is because the ghosts floating around it exchange signs
linkedContent: the reason a code is indispensable to a crypt is because the ghosts floating around it exchange signs

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: crypt: 1) organization of places designed to lead astray 2) topos to conserve/hide living dead 3) cipher/code
linkedContent: crypt: 1) organization of places designed to lead astray 2) topos to conserve/hide living dead 3) cipher/code

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another
linkedContent: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: 1st paradigm of introjection: “fill the mouth’s void w/ words” [Abraham] > language substituted as a figure of presence w/in a community of empty mouths

content: mouth’s empty cavity: 1) place for shouts, sobs, “deferred filling,” 2) place to call mother 3) then, via introj. or auto-affection, “phonic self-filling”
linkedContent: mouth’s empty cavity: 1) place for shouts, sobs, “deferred filling,” 2) place to call mother 3) then, via introj. or auto-affection, “phonic self-filling”

content: other—atopique > means they can never tell you how they want to be eaten

content: introj. as idealization, incorp. refuses metaphor of substitutive supplement, refuses introj.; incorp. fantasy takes introj.'s oral metaphor literally: vomits into inside, into pocket of cyst

linkedContent: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire

linkedContent: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: pocket near pudenda, extra flap of cloth, where most precious thing is kept: money, title, share in stock market [crypt as wallet]
linkedContent: pocket near pudenda, extra flap of cloth, where most precious thing is kept: money, title, share in stock market [crypt as wallet]

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: double desire of crypt, pocket [cf. GLAS Genet’s “matchbox”], pour garder la vie et mettre le mort dans sa poche [near the pudenda], où se tient le plus précieux (money, title, share of stock market): “prise aussi pour le chantage (blackmail) de l’autre”: your wallet or your life
linkedContent: double desire of crypt, pocket [cf. GLAS Genet’s “matchbox”], pour garder la vie et mettre le mort dans sa poche [near the pudenda], où se tient le plus précieux (money, title, share of stock market): “prise aussi pour le chantage (blackmail) de l’autre”: your wallet or your life

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher
linkedContent: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher

source.title: Fors: The Anglish Words of Nicolas Abraham and Maria Torok

content: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story
linkedContent: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story

linkedContent: fantasy of incorporation: treats words as things

linkedContent: “cryptonyms of repressed pleasure words” [re: Grateloup, tieret, rub, scar, Thing]

content: 2 routes (both angular) (double density) the Thing follows at dividing line (the Thing marked by same dividing line as symbol broken by crypt): 1) crosses unconscious directly (tableau, symptom) 2) crosses intrasymbolic crack (alloseme)
linkedContent: 2 routes (both angular) (double density) the Thing follows at dividing line (the Thing marked by same dividing line as symbol broken by crypt): 1) crosses unconscious directly (tableau, symptom) 2) crosses intrasymbolic crack (alloseme)

content: [re: Wolf Man’s cryptonomic translations] phonetic contaminations, nonsemantic associations, neither rhetorical figures nor metonymic displacements > but angular: contact (semantic or formal) w/ surface of its allosemes acc. most economical line/surface; angles make itinerary unreadable, makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration

linkedContent: machinery would attest to existence of crypt

linkedContent: Wolf Man calls himself by unpspeakable name Thing (tieret), gives himself no name > entire body of a proper name always shattered (morcelé) by the topoi, la Chose est un morceau de symbole

content: could Wolf Man read what is written here on his crypt?
linkedContent: could Wolf Man read what is written here on his crypt?

linkedContent: “in you, anonymous reader in this much-sealed case”
